text: was a after Tenryaku and before Ōwa. This period started in October 957Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Tenryaku" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 961. and ended in February 961.Nussbaum, "Ōwa" at p. 767. The reigning emperors was .Titsingh, Isaac. (1834). Annales ds empereurs du japon, pp. 139-142; Brown, Delmer et al. (1979). Gukanshō, pp. 295-298; Varley, H. Paul. (1980). Jinnō Shōtōki, pp. 183-190. ==Events of the Tentoku era== * 957 (Tentoku 1, 4th month): The emperor celebrated the 50th birthday of Fujiwara Morosuke.Titsingh, p. 140. * 958 (Tentoku 2, 3rd month): Fujiwara Saneyori is honored with the privilege of traveling by cart. * 16 October 960 (Tentoku 4, 23rd day of the 9th month): The Imperial palace burned down.Titsingh, p. 141; Brown, p. 297. ==Related pages== * Heian period ==References== ==Other websites== * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Tentoku 1st 2nd 3rd 4th 5th 957 958 959 960 961 Preceded by: Tenryaku Era or nengō: Tentoku Succeeded by: Ōwa Category:Japanese eras Category:10th-century establishments in Japan Category:960s disestablishments in Japan Category:950s establishments
title: Tentoku
